com.st.st25sdk.picopass

Class PicopassTag

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.st.st25sdk.NFCTag
      • com.st.st25sdk.picopass.PicopassTag

  • public class PicopassTag
extends NFCTag
    Defines all required methods to handle PICOPASS tags

      This function sets the M1 and M0 bits M1 M0 = 0 0 : ISO15693-2 Manchester code + ISO14443B 106 kbits/s M1 M0 = 0 1 : ISO15693-2 FSK code + ISO14443B 106 kbits/s M1 M0 = 0 0 : ISO15693-2 Manchester code + ISO14443B 423 kbits/s M1 M0 = 1 1 : RFU + RFU

    • Method Detail

      • setM1M0Bits

        public void setM1M0Bits(byte m1m0Bits)
        This function sets the M1 and M0 bits M1 M0 = 0 0 : ISO15693-2 Manchester code + ISO14443B 106 kbits/s M1 M0 = 0 1 : ISO15693-2 FSK code + ISO14443B 106 kbits/s M1 M0 = 0 0 : ISO15693-2 Manchester code + ISO14443B 423 kbits/s M1 M0 = 1 1 : RFU + RFU
        Parameters:
        m1m0Bits - M1 M0 bits

      • getM1M0Bits

        public byte getM1M0Bits()
        This function returns the M1 and M0 bits
        Returns:
        M1M0 bits

                        int sizeInBytes)
                 throws STException
        Description copied from class: NFCTag

      • writeBytes

        public void writeBytes(int byteAddress,
                       byte[] data)
                throws STException
        Description copied from class: NFCTag
        Write some Bytes at a given address WARNING: After this write, the cache may not be aligned anymore with tag's memory content so it is recommended to invalidate the cache.

        Parameters:
